text: This post legit made my palms sweat a little. That sounds SO uncomfortable! I've never been through something like this, but kudos to you for facing it head on.

elements.text: This post legit made my palms sweat a little. That sounds SO uncomfortable! I've never been through something like this, but kudos to you for facing it head on.

text:
Hiya. Curious if anyone can point me at the right direction or give me an advice on my current situation. My agency is about 2.5 years old and majority of revenue comes from one big account based in San Fran, California. The account is very meticulous about safety, procedures and clean paperwork (normally) and they gave us a heads up that we will have to start paying taxes in US/California based on the income from them.
We are HQ-ed in Europe (Slovenia) and what we are not super fond of is paying taxes twice (to Slo gov’t and US). Has anyone tackled this challenge before? What would you recommend - move the entire company to US? Thanks in advance!

text: Do agency writers and freelancers have a hard time switching between clients in different industries, or do you typically stick within a set of related verticals? I imagine the expertise required to write, especially in very technical industries, varies between clients.
